senses.de: The general direction in which something is changing or developing
senses.ex: The trend in fashion this season is towards bright colors.

Tips.title: Context Matters
Tips.description: The word 'trend' is often used in discussing topics like fashion, technology, and social changes.
Tips.example: There's a trend towards remote working in the tech industry.

Tips.title: Not Always Positive
Tips.description: 'Trend' doesn't imply good or bad, it just shows direction of change.
Tips.example: There is a disturbing trend of increasing pollution in urban areas.

senses.de: To change or develop in a general direction

Tips.title: Social Media Jargon
Tips.description: In social media, 'trending' often means becoming popular or viral at a given moment.
Tips.example: The dance challenge started trending on social media.

Tips.title: Temporal Aspect
Tips.description: When 'trend' is used as a verb, it often indicates a temporary or current movement.
Tips.example: During winter, the temperatures have been trending lower.

senses.ex: Wearing vintage clothes is a trend among young people.

Tips.title: Cultural Nuance
Tips.description: 'Trend' can reflect cultural shifts and generational preferences.
Tips.example: Minimalist lifestyles are a trend among millennials trying to declutter their lives.

Tips.title: Time Frame Reference
Tips.description: Fashion and lifestyle 'trends' can be short-lived, changing from season to season.
Tips.example: Floral patterns are the trend for this spring's clothing lines.

senses.de: To go in a specific direction

Tips.title: Physical Direction
Tips.description: In geography, 'trend' describes the direction something moves or faces, like a mountain range.
Tips.example: The Andes mountain range trends north-south.

Tips.title: Not Always Literal
Tips.description: 'Trend' in geography doesn't mean moving, but the alignment or general direction it follows.
Tips.example: The coral reef trends towards the northeast, parallel to the shoreline.

Craze.wordDefinition:
Craze refers to something that becomes very popular for a short time, but then quickly fades away.

An example of a craze would be a popular toy that kids want to own, but eventually loses its popularity.

A craze is something that becomes very popular for a short period of time, while a trend is something that becomes popular over a longer period and has a lasting impact on society.

Current.wordDefinition:
Current refers to what is happening now at this moment.

It describes something that is existing or happening in the present. For example, the current temperature is 70 degrees Fahrenheit.

Current refers to something happening right now and trend refers to how something is changing over time.

Direction.wordDefinition:
Direction refers to the path or course that something is headed in. It's applicable when talking about specific movements or aims of something.

For example, "The company is headed in a new direction with their marketing strategy."

Drift.wordDefinition:
Drift refers to a gradual change or movement in a particular direction.

It can describe a slow and subtle shift in opinions, attitudes or behaviors. For example, if a person's political beliefs slowly shift towards the left over time, this could be described as a drift in their political views.

So, in simple terms, the difference between drift and trend is that drift refers to a gradual change over time, while trend refers to a general direction that things are moving in.

Fad.wordDefinition:
A fad is a short-lived trend that is popular for a brief period of time and then fades quickly. Fads are often characterized by their novelty and unusualness.

Examples of fads could be trendy clothes, viral dances or memes, or popular gadgets that disappear quickly.

A fad is a temporary craze that quickly fades, while a trend is a more significant shift that is gradually adopted by a large group over time.

Fashion.wordDefinition:
Fashion refers to a general style or design that lasts for a long time, while a trend refers to a popular style that is temporary and changes frequently.

Fashion is applicable to clothes, accessories, and even furniture, and it often reflects the culture and society of a particular era.

In simpler terms, fashion is timeless and classic, while trends are fun and fleeting.

Movement.wordDefinition:
Movement generally refers to a group of people who are actively working towards a common goal or belief, often with a sense of urgency or significance.

This can include social, political, or cultural movements, such as the civil rights movement or the women's rights movement.

Both words can be applicable to a variety of situations, but movement is typically associated with more significant and impactful changes, while trends are often more superficial or fleeting.

Style.wordDefinition:
Style refers to a way of doing things or a particular manner in which something is done. It typically pertains to individual choices and preferences.

For example, an individual can have their own personal style in terms of clothing, music, and art.

It is often temporary and tends to change frequently based on current popular culture. For example, wearing ripped jeans or off-shoulder tops may be considered a trend in fashion in a particular year, but it may not necessarily be a personal style for everyone.

Style is individual, long-lasting, and based on personal choices and tastes, while a trend is popular, short-term, and often influenced by popular culture.

Tendency.wordDefinition:
Tendency refers to a general inclination or direction towards something.

It is often used to describe a person's natural disposition or a gradual change in behavior or attitude over time. For example, a person may have a tendency to procrastinate, meaning they often put off tasks until the last minute.

However, tendency is more focused on an individual's natural predisposition, while trend is more focused on larger societal influences.

quotes.Text: The corporate sector in my view is the most important since it is actively involved in the shaping of our life on the planet. The corporate world has the power and the means to influence politics and public trends.
quotes.Title: Israeli Entertainer
quotes.Name: Yossi Ghinsberg

quotes.Text: The fashion world is so interesting because it's always changing, but if you know yourself really well, despite of all the changes in the fashion trends, you know how to stay true to yourself.
quotes.Title: Malaysian Musician
quotes.Name: Yuna

quotes.Text: I used to be married to a woman who pursued every spiritual trend with tremendous passion and dragged me along. I don't believe in anything. I'd seen mediums and readers.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Harold Ramis

quotes.Text: It's hard to go with a trend. As soon as it's out, everyone picks it up. It's important to stay true to yourself. Have fun with fashion instead of letting it dictate.
quotes.Title: Canadian Model
quotes.Name: Estella Warren

quotes.Text: I think it's very important to women what they want to watch. They're looking all the time to the red carpet to see what to wear, and it sets off all sorts of trends.
quotes.Title: British Designer
quotes.Name: Jenny Packham

quotes.Text: I do think that character types trend. As a female comedian, the parts that come my way are often terrible women.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Jenny Slate

quotes.Text: For me, clothes are kind of character; I don't follow fashion or understand trends.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Meryl Streep

quotes.Text: I like experimenting and picking up trends from across the world.
quotes.Title: Indian Actor
quotes.Name: Gurmeet Choudhary

quotes.Text: The single most important top-level trend is the shift to mobile.
quotes.Title: Ukrainian Businessman
quotes.Name: Max Levchin

quotes.Text: I rarely drop the ball, and hopefully that trend continues.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Zach Ertz
